  1. Unnamed Package

Uses of Package

  • Classes in Unnamed Package used by Unnamed Package
    Class
    Description
    Amoeba
    Represents an Amoeba entity in the game.
    Data
    A singleton class responsible for managing user data and game levels.
    Direction
    Enum representing the four cardinal directions: UP, DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT.
    Enemy
    This Abstract Enemy class extends Entity and is intended to hold an abstract functions to find its future moves.
    Entity
    Abstract Entity class derived from abstract GameObject class.
    Exit
    Represents an Exit tile in the game.
    GameController
    GameController class is responsible for managing the core logic of the game.
    GameObject
    Abstract GameObject class that holds the sprite, centre of sprite, position, update rate and collision status of game objects.
    GraphicsController
    The GraphicsController class is responsible for rendering game objects on the provided canvas.
    GridPosition
    Represents integer position pair.
    HighScore
    The HighScore class represents a high score achieved by a user.
    Item
    The Item class represents an entity that can fall and roll in the game.
    Key
     
    KeyColour
    Enum representing the various colors of keys in the game.
    Level
    Represents a level in the game, storing high scores and providing methods to manage level data and user scores.
    LockedDoor
    Abstract class representing a locked door on the game map.
    Map
    Representation of the game's map.
    Node
    Nodes for the A* pathfinding.
    PathfindingEnemy
    Super for Frog and Goblin, uses A* to find the fastest path to the player.
    PatrollingEnemy
    Super for Butterfly and Firefly, uses Movement priority to find the next path to move to.
    Player
     
    Tile
    Abstract Tile class derived from abstract GameObject class.
    User
    Represents a user in the game with their name, unlocked levels, and the current level in progress.
